PyAnnotation Module - data.py¶

class PyAnnotation.PyAnnotation[source]¶

A PyAnnotation is the artifcat being annotated.

An annotation is a labelled feature structure. The annotation class/interface also provides convenience methods for setting and getting values from a feature structure.

add(name, value)[source]¶

Creates and add a PyFeature to this PyAnnotation.

name : str
Name of the PyFeature to be added.
value : int
Value of the PyFeature to be added.
addFeature(f)[source]¶

Adds the passed PyFeature to this PyAnnotation

f : object
PyFeature is object.
features()[source]¶

Returns the features.

features : array_like
List of the PyFeatures of this PyAnnotation.
fromAnnotation(a)[source]¶

Construct a new PyAnnotation.

a : int
PyAnnotation is object.
getFeature(name)[source]¶

Searches for a PyFeature in this PyAnnotation list by name.

name : str

feature : feature
PyFeature.
getFeatureValue(name)[source]¶

Searches for a PyFeature in this PyAnnotation list by name, returns that PyFeature value.

name : str

featureValue : str
Or None.
